5.22.24  2:39 pm   A while ago I asked you why the speed sign in "two friends on the beach" was only 25mph. I'm just now realizing that it's not 25 KILOMETERS per hour (it's actually about 40, I think?), and it wasn't ridiculously slow. Sorry abt that ðŸ«¡

Â Â Â Â Â  it's mph, and it's based on an actual speed limit sign on an actual street, which is indeed 25mph. If a sign in that style were in KM, then it should have said "maximum speed" (canada) instead of "speed limit" (USA)

5.21.24  9:05 pm   Your videos give me this strange sense of childhood wonder. It feels like I'm a kid again, just existing and enjoying the world around me without having to worry about any stupid responsibilities. But I lose that happiness the moment I click off. How could I keep that happiness and integrate it into my life?

Â Â Â Â Â  i'm not sure

5.21.24  8:04 pm   bill wurtz i just want to thank you for being the catalyst for my interest in making music.
i thought about it today, and i realised that without your music being so free and weird but still good, i wouldn't have found much value in music and i would never have had the confidence to make music myxelf.

so in conjunction with this realisation, i want to ask you:
When did you learn that you could have so much freedom making music / that you wanted to make music by your own rules?

Â Â Â Â Â  after listening to enough music, i eventually got the hang of what it is that we're going for. and at the end of the day it's a mixture of familiarity and unfamiliarity

5.21.24  2:11 pm   how do i immigrate to piano country where the national language is piano

Â Â Â Â Â  the key is to make sure the country you're coming from is of lower status than the piano country. If your original country is of higher status, then it will not be called "immirgration", it will be called "expatriation"

5.21.24  4:06 am   are you autistic

Â Â Â Â Â  on the questionaire, all the questions about numbers/dates i'm like "hell yes, that's me". all the questions about having trouble recognizing people's emotions, i'm like "no, that's not me, i'm actually very good at that." then a large portion of the questions are incoherently vague, such as "do you tend to like things?" and then a bunch of the questions seem to be stuck in the past. like "would you rather watch a horse race or go to the opera"
